headline: Another Capitol riot participant is cooperating with the Jan. 6 committee. She's reasoning that her cooperation should earn her a reduced sentence.
sentences:
[Investigator] Sean Quinn stated his appreciation for her candor and honesty.?
Seeking a reduced sentence: Shaner said Krzywicki's interview with the panel was important to show her genuine remorse and to help her as well as our nation to make sense of what occurred that heartbreaking day.?
What Krzywicki did: Prosecutors say Krzywicki and her mother, Jean Lavin, arrived in Washington too late to see Donald Trump's speech but meandered with the crowd until they reached the Capitol.

The existing opposition: House Democrats have joined Republicans in introducing a bill that would prevent the Biden administration from lifting the Trump-era provision without a plan to address an anticipated surge of immigrants at the border.

Tap, scroll or click for more g
What's happening: The Biden administration's lifting of a pandemic-borne provision known as Title 42 that allows the government to limit migration at the southern border due to public health concerns is drawing new opposition from a prominent progressive.

Tap, scroll or click for more g
What happened: Republicans are accusing the Biden administration of hypocrisy after extending a mask mandate for public transportation right after ending Title 42, a provision that would restrict immigration at the southern border due to the pandemic.

Senate Democrats have introduced a bill of their own calling for a 60-day extension of the Title 42 policy, along with requiring the Department of Homeland Security to create a plan that would deal with the influx of migrants.

Carla Krzywicki of Connecticut said she spoke with three investigators from the Jan. 6 select committee last month to describe her motivation for participating in the events of that day.
